# Appendix B: Glossery of plays {.unnumbered}

This appendix contains a table of Yiddish Theater plays that Sam mentions, either as a play he performed in, attended, or refers to someone else performing in.
Plays are listed in order of first appearance.

In the `Playwright/composer(s)` column, I provide names of those who were _documented_ to have been involved writing the play and/or music.
An absence of a composer or lyricist does not imply that the main playwright necessary also wrote the songs; in many cases, this information is just not definitively known (or I haven't found it yet!).
It was also common for songs to be added to plays by additional songwriters who were not officially credited.

<!-- turns out it is the female pioneer? [^divorce]: This is not quite an accurate translation. Instead, _Khalitse_ refers to the formal procedure that releases a man from the obligation of having to marry his brother's widow.-->
[^notasch]: Not to be confused with the [book of the same name by Sholem Asch](https://www.yiddishbookcenter.org/collections/yiddish-books/spb-nybc203723/asch-sholem-kidesh-hashem), which was later [adapted into a play](https://www.moyt.org/exhibitions/pih/kiddush-hashem.htm)
[^immigrant]: Not to be confused with the [book of the same name by {{< var kobrin-full >}}](https://yiddishkayt.org/view/kobrin/)
[^greenhorns]: Also known as _Mishke un Moshke, oder Eyropeyer in Amerike_ (_Mishke and Moshke, Europeans in America_)
[^maybe]: This might not actually be a partial script of this play. If it isn't, it's certainly a piece of related content.
[^tzimmes]: Noting I have also seen this referred to as _Dovid Velvele eats tzimmes_ ([Source](https://www.nli.org.il/en/newspapers/dwt/1913/04/30/01/article/62.3))
